headline: B.C.-bound border waits lengthened by U.S. inspections
context: Travellers bound for B.C. from Washington state reported long waits Friday, and traffic volume does not appear to be the sole reason for the delays.

Both CTV News Vancouver and KOMO News Seattle were contacted by travellers who said U.S. border officials were searching every Canada-bound vehicle before it reached the border and dealt with the Canada Border Services Agency.

annotations.paragraph: The CBSA referred questions to U.S. Customs and Border Patrol.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides relevant information about the CBSA's response to inquiries.

annotations.paragraph: In a brief statement to KOMO News, the CBP did not confirm that it was inspecting every northbound vehicle, nor did it explain what – if anything – prompted the increased scrutiny on Friday.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is relevant as it addresses the lack of confirmation from CBP about the inspections.

annotations.paragraph: “As part of its national security mission, U.S. Customs and Border Protection routinely conducts inspections on outbound traffic,” the CBP said in the statement.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about the CBP's routine operations.

annotations.paragraph: “These inspections are a vital tool in apprehending wanted individuals as well as in seizing a variety of contraband – which ultimately makes our communities safer.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers general information about the purpose of inspections, not specific to the current situation.

annotations.paragraph: A Washington state Department of Transportation traffic camera showed what appeared to be a police checkpoint funnelling Canada-bound traffic into a single lane before the Peace Arch border crossing.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides visual evidence of the situation at the border.

annotations.paragraph: The CBP’s online border wait time tracker for the Peace Arch crossing showed 40-minute waits for travellers from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Friday.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific data on wait times, which is directly relevant to the headline about border wait lengthening.

annotations.paragraph: Typical wait times at 11 a.m., according to the CBP, are less than 20 minutes.
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers a comparison to typical wait times, highlighting the unusual delay, which is relevant to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Wait times declined to more normal ranges in the 2 p.m. hour.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides information on when the wait times returned to normal, contributing to the narrative of the delays.
